    awardFindR

    Source: vignettes/awardFindR.Rmd
    awardFindR.Rmd

    search_awards is meant to be the top-level function for interacting with grant database search functions.

    Load awardFindR 

    library(awardFindR)

    Simple keyword search, single source 

    nsf <- search_awards(keywords="illicit", sources="nsf", from_date="2023-01-01")
str(nsf)
#> 'data.frame':    20 obs. of  12 variables:
#>  $ institution: chr  "University of Tennessee Knoxville" "Dartmouth College" "The University of Central Florida Board of Trustees" "George Mason University" ...
#>  $ pi         : chr  "Wang, Zhenbo" "Zhang, Xiaojing (John)" "Yao, Fan" "El-Amine, Hadi" ...
#>  $ year       : chr  "2023" "2023" "2024" "2023" ...
#>  $ start      : chr  "2023-04-01" "2023-09-01" "2024-03-01" "2023-01-01" ...
#>  $ end        : chr  "2024-07-31" "2026-08-31" "2029-02-28" "2023-12-31" ...
#>  $ program    : chr  "47.070" "47.041" "47.070" "47.041" ...
#>  $ amount     : chr  "150000.00" "399541.00" "556875.00" "79773.00" ...
#>  $ id         : chr  "2231710" "2318814" "2340777" "2247286" ...
#>  $ title      : chr  "SCC-PG: Securing Underserved Communities from Drug Abuse with Drone-Based Smart Medication Delivery" "Label-free Detection of Opioids in Liquid Using Zinc Oxide Nanophotonic Sensor" "CAREER: Understanding and Ensuring Secure-by-design Microarchitecture in Modern Era of Computing" "Conference and Grantee's Meeting: Disrupting Operations of Illicit Supply Networks; Arlington, Virginia; 27-28 March 2023" ...
#>  $ abstract   : chr  "Despite considerable efforts in combating substance use and exploring novel treatment and recovery strategies, "| __truncated__ "Illicit drug abuse has become another major national health crisis since the Covid-19<br/>pandemic started, due"| __truncated__ "Microarchitectural attacks (i.e., side and covert channels) have opened a new chapter in computer system securi"| __truncated__ "Networks that illegally traffic in everything from people and drugs to human organs and nuclear material pose s"| __truncated__ ...
#>  $ keyword    : chr  "illicit" "illicit" "illicit" "illicit" ...
#>  $ source     : chr  "NSF" "NSF" "NSF" "NSF" ...

    Multiple sources and keywords, specific date range 

    nsf_and_nih <- search_awards(keywords=c("ontological", "audio recordings"), sources=c("nsf", "nih"), from_date="2018-01-01", to_date="2018-02-01")
table(nsf_and_nih$source)
#> < table of extent 0 >
unique(nsf_and_nih$keyword)
#> NULL

    For more than a few keywords, you can specify an external simple csv file. If you specify a .csv file path for keywords, the file should be a list of keywords, one string per line. For example:

    qualitative data
qualitative analysis
case study
case studies
